title: Challenge-Based Learning (CBL) Program for Developing Interdisciplinary Project Management Efficacy

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners primarily access content via smartphones and collaborate with team members from diverse academic backgrounds.

learning_goals: Learners can positively perceive self-directed interdisciplinary team formation and establish collaborative strategies integrating diverse perspectives.
Through Challenge-Based Learning (CBL), they can improve project management efficacy by over 20% while solving real-world social issues.

Learners analyze formative assessment feedback (code review, test results, team evaluation surveys) to revise ≥3 team role allocation plans, propose two concrete improvements for the decision-making process (e.g., technology stack selection criteria, task prioritization methods), and achieve final project outcomes (functional completeness ≥90%, team satisfaction ≥4/5).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
